nl.tudelft.jpacman.level

Class Level

  • java.lang.Object
    • nl.tudelft.jpacman.level.Level
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    AILevel

    public abstract class Level
extends java.lang.Object
    A level of Pac-Man. A level consists of the board with the players and the AIs on it.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static interface  Level.LevelObserver
      An observer that will be notified when the level is won or lost.

    • Constructor Summary

      Creates a new level for the board.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Level

        public Level(Board b,
             java.util.List<NPC> ghosts,
             java.util.List<Square> startPositions,
             CollisionMap collisionMap)
        Creates a new level for the board.
        Parameters:
        b - The board for the level.
        ghosts - The ghosts on the board.
        startPositions - The squares on which players start on this board.
        collisionMap - The collection of collisions that should be handled.

    • Method Detail

      • addObserver

        public void addObserver(Level.LevelObserver observer)
        Adds an observer that will be notified when the level is won or lost.
        Parameters:
        observer - The observer that will be notified.

      • registerPlayer

        public void registerPlayer(IdentifiedPlayer p)
        Registers a player on this level, assigning him to a starting position. A player can only be registered once, registering a player again will have no effect.
        Parameters:
        p - The player to register.

      • getBoard

        public Board getBoard()
        Returns the board of this level.
        Returns:
        The board of this level.

      • move

        public void move(Unit unit,
                 Direction direction)
        Moves the unit into the given direction if possible and handles all collisions.
        Parameters:
        unit - The unit to move.
        direction - The direction to move the unit in.

      • isInProgress

        public boolean isInProgress()
        Returns whether this level is in progress, i.e. whether moves can be made on the board.
        Returns:
        true iff this level is in progress.

      • setInProgress

        public void setInProgress(boolean inProgress)
        Setter for the inProgress field.
        Parameters:
        inProgress - Whether the game has to be set to "in progress"

      • updateObservers

        public void updateObservers()
        Updates the observers about the state of this level.

      • isAnyPlayerAlive

        public boolean isAnyPlayerAlive()
        Returns true iff at least one of the players in this level is alive.
        Returns:
        true if at least one of the registered players is alive.

      • remainingPellets

        public int remainingPellets()
        Counts the pellets remaining on the board.
        Returns:
        The amount of pellets remaining on the board or 0 if 'finished' is true.

      • onPlayerLoseLife

        public void onPlayerLoseLife(IdentifiedPlayer p)
        Called when a player that has registered this Level loses one life. If he has some more lives, he is moved on the board (away from ghosts) so that he can keep on playing from a safer place.
        Parameters:
        p - The Player that just lost one life.

      • getPlayer

        public IdentifiedPlayer getPlayer()
        Get the player of the game.
        Returns:
        the player.

      • getGhostList

        public java.util.List<Ghost> getGhostList()
        Get the ghost's list.
        Returns:
        the ghost's list.

      • addToGhostList

        public void addToGhostList(Ghost g)
        Adds the given ghost to the list of ghosts.
        Parameters:
        g - The ghost to add.

      • setFinished

        public void setFinished()
        Simple setter for the 'finished' field that allows a level. to be considered finished for testing purposes. (remainingPellets should therefore return 0 in all circumstances)
